link.title: Midway R-I - COVID-19

hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: SCHOOL MEALS to be Delivered to Midway R-I Communities

h3.div: Starting Monday, March 23, and for the duration of our school cancellation, Midway Food Service will prepare and deliver BREAKFASTS AND LUNCHES to our communities of Cleveland, Freeman, Lake Annette and West Line.

The meals will be packaged for GRAB-N-GO service. Breakfast and lunch will be provided at the same time. All meals will be ready-to-eat items or microwavable at home. The meals will be provided FREE TO ALL students and preschoolers, even if the family does not qualify for free or reduced-price meals during the regular school year.
Meals may be picked up by students, parents or babysitters. The meals will be distributed to each community at the following times:
West Line 8:45 to 9:05 a.m. Main Intersection
Lake Annette 9:20 to 9:40 a.m. Community Building
Cleveland 9:00 to 9:30 a.m. City Hall/Community Bldg
Families who live in remote locations and cannot travel to the pickup locations may call the school (816.250.2994) for home delivery. Eat well! Eat healthy!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: All of us in the Midway R-I community are sailing in uncharted waters. The coronavirus epidemic (i.e. COVID-19) presents new information each day, and sometimes it changes during the day. Please take time to review the following items.

1. All classes, activities, events and practices are cancelled. We will cancel week by week and make the announcement for the following week about noon each Saturday on the district’s alert system, which sends voice message, text and email.
2. The school building is closed. Maintenance personnel are continuing with deep cleaning.
3. The Cass County Health Department informed us late yesterday that a case of COVID-19 has been confirmed in the Drexel area.

4. The administrators are planning for a potential long-term closure. We may be offering online learning activities. However, we know that not all families have Internet connection, and some of the Internet service providers in our area have limited bandwidth and connection speeds.
5. We need to know if any families are experiencing food insufficiency. If needed, we would begin to work out a plan for getting meals to families requesting meals.
6. The Missouri State High School Activities Association (MSHSAA) has suspended all activities.

7. At this time we do not have answers to all questions. We will have answers for the following and other questions when we have more information. If you have questions, please send an email to MHS principal Ms. Gibson (agibson@midwayk12.net), MES principal Mr. Dean (cdean@midwayk12.net), special programs director Ms. Newkirk (hnewkirk@midwayk12.net), athletic director Mr. Riggs (jriggs@midwayk12.net) or superintendent Gordon Myers (gmyers@midwayk12.net). What we don’t know at this time:
a. Will we have to make up the missed days? This will be answered at the state level (DESE).
b. How will we account for course credits if we miss the rest of the year? Also answered by DESE.

c. Will we have prom and after-prom? Time will tell. We hope to have prom. It may need to be rescheduled to a later date. We will adhere to the group size recommendations of public health professionals.
d. Will we be able to hold graduation? We certainly hope so. Again, this will depend on group size recommendations.
e. Will we have a track season and state meet? This will be answered by the MSHSAA.
8. We are attempting to gather some information from our parents/guardians and the community. We have posted a survey to our website www.midwayk12.net that we would like for everyone to complete.
9. We will update these memos weekly or as needed.

p.strong: 10. Above all, we sincerely appreciate the patience and understanding of everyone as we proceed through this unprecedented time in our school community.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Parents please click the "Parent Input" link above to fill out a data survey for the district. We would like for our families to answer a few questions regarding meal needs and other information regarding the possibility of an extended closure.
